member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription
member.summary: A description of a consumer from a Service Provider's point of view.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription.Key
member.summary: Gets the Consumer key.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription.Secret
member.summary: Gets the consumer secret.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription.Certificate
member.summary: Gets the certificate that can be used to verify the signature of an incoming message from a Consumer.
member.returns: The public key from the Consumer's X.509 Certificate, if one can be found; otherwise null.
member.remarks: This property must be implemented only if the RSA-SHA1 algorithm is supported by the Service Provider.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription.Callback
member.summary: Gets the callback URI that this consumer has pre-registered with the service provider, if any.
member.value: A URI that user authorization responses should be directed to; or null if no preregistered callback was arranged.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription.VerificationCodeFormat
member.summary: Gets the verification code format that is most appropriate for this consumer when a callback URI is not available.
member.value: A set of characters that can be easily keyed in by the user given the Consumer's application type and form factor.
member.remarks: The value should NEVER be returned since this property is only used in no callback scenarios anyway.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IConsumerDescription.VerificationCodeLength
member.summary: Gets the length of the verification code to issue for this Consumer.
member.value: A positive number, generally at least 4.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderAccessToken
member.summary: A description of an access token and its metadata as required by a Service Provider.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderAccessToken.Token
member.summary: Gets the token itself.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderAccessToken.ExpirationDate
member.summary: Gets the expiration date (local time) for the access token.
member.value: The expiration date, or null if there is no expiration date.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderAccessToken.Username
member.summary: Gets the username of the principal that will be impersonated by this access token.
member.value: The name of the user who authorized the OAuth request token originally.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderAccessToken.Roles
member.summary: Gets the roles that the OAuth principal should belong to.
member.value: The roles that the user belongs to, or a subset of these according to the rights granted when the user authorized the request token.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken
member.summary: A description of a request token and its metadata as required by a Service Provider

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken.Token
member.summary: Gets the token itself.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken.ConsumerKey
member.summary: Gets the consumer key that requested this token.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken.CreatedOn
member.summary: Gets the (local) date that this request token was first created on.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken.Callback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback associated specifically with this token, if any.
member.value: The callback URI; or null if no callback was specifically assigned to this token.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken.VerificationCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the verifier that the consumer must include in the message to exchange this request token for an access token.
member.value: The verifier code, or null if none has been assigned (yet).

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken.ConsumerVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the Consumer that requested this token.
member.remarks: This property is used to determine whether a must be generated when the user authorizes the Consumer or not.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager
member.summary: A token manager for use by a web site in its role as a service provider.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager.GetConsumer(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the Consumer description for a given a Consumer Key.
member.param: The Consumer Key.
member.returns: A description of the consumer. Never null.
member.exception: Thrown if the consumer key cannot be found.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager.IsRequestTokenAuthorized(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a given request token has already been authorized by some user for use by the Consumer that requested it.
member.param: The Consumer's request token.
member.returns: True if the request token has already been fully authorized by the user who owns the relevant protected resources. False if the token has not yet been authorized, has expired or does not exist.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager.GetRequestToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets details on the named request token.
member.param: The request token.
member.returns: A description of the token. Never null.
member.exception: Thrown if the token cannot be found.
member.remarks: It is acceptable for implementations to find the token, see that it has expired, delete it from the database and then throw , or alternatively it can return the expired token anyway and the OAuth channel will log and throw the appropriate error.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager.GetAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets details on the named access token.
member.param: The access token.
member.returns: A description of the token. Never null.
member.exception: Thrown if the token cannot be found.
member.remarks: It is acceptable for implementations to find the token, see that it has expired, delete it from the database and then throw , or alternatively it can return the expired token anyway and the OAuth channel will log and throw the appropriate error.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager.UpdateToken(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken)
member.summary: Persists any changes made to the token.
member.param: The token whose properties have been changed.
member.remarks: This library will invoke this method after making a set of changes to the token as part of a web request to give the host the opportunity to persist those changes to a database. Depending on the object persistence framework the host site uses, this method MAY not need to do anything (if changes made to the token will automatically be saved without any extra handling).

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract
member.summary: Code contract class for the interface.

member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created.

member.summary: Gets the Consumer description for a given a Consumer Key.

member.returns: A description of the consumer. Never null.
member.exception: Thrown if the consumer key cannot be found.

member.summary: Checks whether a given request token has already been authorized by some user for use by the Consumer that requested it.
member.param: The Consumer's request token.
member.returns: True if the request token has already been fully authorized by the user who owns the relevant protected resources. False if the token has not yet been authorized, has expired or does not exist.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#IServiceProviderTokenManager#GetRequestToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets details on the named request token.
member.param: The request token.
member.returns: A description of the token. Never null.
member.exception: Thrown if the token cannot be found.
member.remarks: It is acceptable for implementations to find the token, see that it has expired, delete it from the database and then throw , or alternatively it can return the expired token anyway and the OAuth channel will log and throw the appropriate error.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#IServiceProviderTokenManager#GetAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets details on the named access token.
member.param: The access token.
member.returns: A description of the token. Never null.
member.exception: Thrown if the token cannot be found.
member.remarks: It is acceptable for implementations to find the token, see that it has expired, delete it from the database and then throw , or alternatively it can return the expired token anyway and the OAuth channel will log and throw the appropriate error.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#IServiceProviderTokenManager#UpdateToken(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderRequestToken)
member.summary: Persists any changes made to the token.
member.param: The token whose properties have been changed.
member.remarks: This library will invoke this method after making a set of changes to the token as part of a web request to give the host the opportunity to persist those changes to a database. Depending on the object persistence framework the host site uses, this method MAY not need to do anything (if changes made to the token will automatically be saved without any extra handling).

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#ITokenManager#GetTokenSecret(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the Token Secret given a request or access token.
member.param: The request or access token.
member.returns: The secret associated with the given token.
member.exception: Thrown if the secret cannot be found for the given token.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#ITokenManager#StoreNewRequestToken(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.UnauthorizedTokenRequest,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.ITokenSecretContainingMessage)
member.summary: Stores a newly generated unauthorized request token, secret, and optional application-specific parameters for later recall.
member.param: The request message that resulted in the generation of a new unauthorized request token.
The response message that includes the unauthorized request token.
member.exception: Thrown if the consumer key is not registered, or a required parameter was not found in the parameters collection.
member.remarks: Request tokens stored by this method SHOULD NOT associate any user account with this token. It usually opens up security holes in your application to do so. Instead, you associate a user account with access tokens (not request tokens) in the method.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#ITokenManager#ExpireRequestTokenAndStoreNewAccessToken(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a request token and its associated secret and stores a new access token and secret.
member.param: The Consumer that is exchanging its request token for an access token.
The Consumer's request token that should be deleted/expired.
The new access token that is being issued to the Consumer.
The secret associated with the newly issued access token.

remarks.para: Any scope of granted privileges associated with the request token from the original call to should be carried over to the new Access Token.

To associate a user account with the new access token, HttpContext.Current.User may be useful in an ASP.NET web application within the implementation of this method. Alternatively you may store the access token here without associating with a user account, and wait until WebConsumer.ProcessUserAuthorization or DesktopConsumer.ProcessUserAuthorization return the access token to associate the access token with a user account at that point.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManagerContract.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth#ChannelElements#ITokenManager#GetTokenType(System.String)
member.summary: Classifies a token as a request token or an access token.
member.param: The token to classify.
member.returns: Request or Access token, or invalid if the token is not recognized.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.ITokenGenerator
member.summary: An interface allowing OAuth hosts to inject their own algorithm for generating tokens and secrets.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.ITokenGenerator.GenerateRequestToken(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a new token to represent a not-yet-authorized request to access protected resources.
member.param: The consumer that requested this token.
member.returns: The newly generated token.
member.remarks: This method should not store the newly generated token in any persistent store. This will be done in .

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.ITokenGenerator.GenerateAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a new token to represent an authorized request to access protected resources.
member.param: The consumer that requested this token.
member.returns: The newly generated token.
member.remarks: This method should not store the newly generated token in any persistent store. This will be done in .

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.ITokenGenerator.GenerateSecret
member.summary: Returns a cryptographically strong random string for use as a token secret.
member.returns: The generated string.

member.summary: Represents an OAuth consumer that is impersonating a known user on the system.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the consumer secret for a given consumer key.

member.returns: The consumer secret.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthServiceProviderChannel.InitializeBindingElements(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.ITamperProtectionChannelBindingElement,DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.Bindings.INonceStore,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.ITokenManager,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.SecuritySettings)
member.summary: Initializes the binding elements for the OAuth channel.

The nonce store.
The token manager.
The security settings.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthServiceProviderMessageFactory
member.summary: An OAuth-protocol specific implementation of the interface.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthServiceProviderMessageFactory.tokenManager
member.summary: The token manager to use for discerning between request and access tokens.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthServiceProviderMessageFactory.#ctor(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.IServiceProviderTokenManager)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The token manager instance to use.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthServiceProviderMessageFactory.GetNewRequestMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.MessageReceivingEndpoint,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Analyzes an incoming request message payload to discover what kind of message is embedded in it and returns the type, or null if no match is found.
member.param: The intended or actual recipient of the request message.
The name/value pairs that make up the message payload.
member.returns: A newly instantiated -derived object that this message can deserialize to. Null if the request isn't recognized as a valid protocol message.
member.remarks: The request messages are: UnauthorizedTokenRequest AuthorizedTokenRequest UserAuthorizationRequest AccessProtectedResourceRequest

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.OAuthServiceProviderMessageFactory.GetNewResponseMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.IDirectedProtocolMessage,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Analyzes an incoming request message payload to discover what kind of message is embedded in it and returns the type, or null if no match is found.
member.param: The message that was sent as a request that resulted in the response. Null on a Consumer site that is receiving an indirect message from the Service Provider.
The name/value pairs that make up the message payload.
member.returns: The -derived concrete class that this message can deserialize to. Null if the request isn't recognized as a valid protocol message.
member.remarks: The response messages are: None.

member.summary: A binding element for Service Providers to manage the callbacks and verification codes on applicable messages.

member.summary: The token manager offered by the service provider.

member.summary: The security settings for this service provider.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The token manager.
The security settings.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.TokenHandlingBindingElement.ProcessOutgoingMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.IProtocolMessage)
member.summary: Prepares a message for sending based on the rules of this channel binding element.
member.param: The message to prepare for sending.
member.returns: The protections (if any) that this binding element applied to the message. Null if this binding element did not even apply to this binding element.
member.remarks: Implementations that provide message protection must honor the properties where applicable.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.TokenHandlingBindingElement.ProcessIncomingMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.Messaging.IProtocolMessage)
member.summary: Performs any transformation on an incoming message that may be necessary and/or validates an incoming message based on the rules of this channel binding element.
member.param: The incoming message to process.
member.returns: The protections (if any) that this binding element applied to the message. Null if this binding element did not even apply to this binding element.
member.exception: Thrown when the binding element rules indicate that this message is invalid and should NOT be processed.
member.remarks: Implementations that provide message protection must honor the properties where applicable.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.TokenHandlingBindingElement.VerifyThrowTokenNotExpired(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.AccessProtectedResourceRequest)
member.summary: Ensures that access tokens have not yet expired.
member.param: The incoming message carrying the access token.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.TokenHandlingBindingElement.VerifyThrowTokenTimeToLive(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.ITokenContainingMessage)
member.summary: Ensures that short-lived request tokens included in incoming messages have not expired.
member.param: The incoming message.
member.exception: Thrown when the token in the message has expired.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.TokenHandlingBindingElement.Channel
member.summary: Gets or sets the channel that this binding element belongs to.
member.remarks: This property is set by the channel when it is first constructed.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ChannelElements.TokenHandlingBindingElement.Protection
member.summary: Gets the protection commonly offered (if any) by this binding element.
member.remarks: This value is used to assist in sorting binding elements in the channel stack.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider
member.summary: A web application that allows access via OAuth.

remarks.para: The Service Providerâ€™s documentation should include:

list.item: The URLs (Request URLs) the Consumer will use when making OAuth requests, and the HTTP methods (i.e. GET, POST, etc.) used in the Request Token URL and Access Token URL.
Signature methods supported by the Service Provider.
Any additional request parameters that the Service Provider requires in order to obtain a Token. Service Provider specific parameters MUST NOT begin with oauth_.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ApplicationStoreKey
member.summary: The name of the key to use in the HttpApplication cache to store the instance of to use.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.VerifierCodeLength
member.summary: The length of the verifier code (in raw bytes before base64 encoding) to generate.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.channel
member.summary: The field behind the property.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The endpoints and behavior on the Service Provider.
The host's method of storing and recalling tokens and secrets.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The host's method of storing and recalling tokens and secrets.

An object that can figure out what type of message is being received for deserialization.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.CreateVerificationCode(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a cryptographically strong random verification code.
member.param: The desired format of the verification code.
The length of the code. When is , this is the length of the original byte array before base64 encoding rather than the actual length of the final string.
member.returns: The verification code.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadRequest
member.summary: Reads any incoming OAuth message.
member.returns: The deserialized message.
member.remarks: Requires HttpContext.Current.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadRequest(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Reads any incoming OAuth message.
member.param: The HTTP request to read the message from.
member.returns: The deserialized message.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadTokenRequest
member.summary: Gets the incoming request for an unauthorized token, if any.
member.returns: The incoming request, or null if no OAuth message was attached.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected OAuth message is attached to the incoming request.
member.remarks: Requires HttpContext.Current.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadTokenRequest(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Reads a request for an unauthorized token from the incoming HTTP request.
member.param: The HTTP request to read from.
member.returns: The incoming request, or null if no OAuth message was attached.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected OAuth message is attached to the incoming request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.PrepareUnauthorizedTokenMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.UnauthorizedTokenRequest)
member.summary: Prepares a message containing an unauthorized token for the Consumer to use in a user agent redirect for subsequent authorization.
member.param: The token request message the Consumer sent that the Service Provider is now responding to.
member.returns: The response message to send using the , after optionally adding extra data to it.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadAuthorizationRequest
member.summary: Gets the incoming request for the Service Provider to authorize a Consumer's access to some protected resources.
member.returns: The incoming request, or null if no OAuth message was attached.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected OAuth message is attached to the incoming request.
member.remarks: Requires HttpContext.Current.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadAuthorizationRequest(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Reads in a Consumer's request for the Service Provider to obtain permission from the user to authorize the Consumer's access of some protected resource(s).
member.param: The HTTP request to read from.
member.returns: The incoming request, or null if no OAuth message was attached.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected OAuth message is attached to the incoming request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.PrepareAuthorizationResponse(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.UserAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Prepares the message to send back to the consumer following proper authorization of a token by an interactive user at the Service Provider's web site.
member.param: The Consumer's original authorization request.
member.returns: The message to send to the Consumer using if one is necessary. Null if the Consumer did not request a callback as part of the authorization request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.PrepareAuthorizationResponse(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.UserAuthorizationRequest,System.Uri)
member.summary: Prepares the message to send back to the consumer following proper authorization of a token by an interactive user at the Service Provider's web site.
member.param: The Consumer's original authorization request.
The callback URI the consumer has previously registered with this service provider or that came in the .
member.returns: The message to send to the Consumer using .

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadAccessTokenRequest
member.summary: Gets the incoming request to exchange an authorized token for an access token.
member.returns: The incoming request, or null if no OAuth message was attached.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected OAuth message is attached to the incoming request.
member.remarks: Requires HttpContext.Current.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadAccessTokenRequest(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Reads in a Consumer's request to exchange an authorized request token for an access token.
member.param: The HTTP request to read from.
member.returns: The incoming request, or null if no OAuth message was attached.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected OAuth message is attached to the incoming request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.PrepareAccessTokenMessage(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.AuthorizedTokenRequest)
member.summary: Prepares and sends an access token to a Consumer, and invalidates the request token.
member.param: The Consumer's message requesting an access token.
member.returns: The HTTP response to actually send to the Consumer.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadProtectedResourceAuthorization
member.summary: Gets the authorization (access token) for accessing some protected resource.
member.returns: The authorization message sent by the Consumer, or null if no authorization message is attached.
member.remarks: This method verifies that the access token and token secret are valid. It falls on the caller to verify that the access token is actually authorized to access the resources being requested.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected message is attached to the request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadProtectedResourceAuthorization(System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpRequestMessageProperty,System.Uri)
member.summary: Gets the authorization (access token) for accessing some protected resource.
member.param: HTTP details from an incoming WCF message.
The URI of the WCF service endpoint.
member.returns: The authorization message sent by the Consumer, or null if no authorization message is attached.
member.remarks: This method verifies that the access token and token secret are valid. It falls on the caller to verify that the access token is actually authorized to access the resources being requested.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected message is attached to the request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ReadProtectedResourceAuthorization(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Gets the authorization (access token) for accessing some protected resource.
member.param: The incoming HTTP request.
member.returns: The authorization message sent by the Consumer, or null if no authorization message is attached.
member.remarks: This method verifies that the access token and token secret are valid. It falls on the caller to verify that the access token is actually authorized to access the resources being requested.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected message is attached to the request.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.CreatePrincipal(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.Messages.AccessProtectedResourceRequest)
member.summary: Creates a security principal that may be used.
member.param: The request.
member.returns: The instance that can be used for access control of resources.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.HttpApplicationStore
member.summary: Gets the standard state storage mechanism that uses ASP.NET's HttpApplication state dictionary to store associations and nonces.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.ServiceDescription
member.summary: Gets the description of this Service Provider.

member.summary: Gets or sets the generator responsible for generating new tokens and secrets.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.TokenManager
member.summary: Gets the persistence store for tokens and secrets.

member.summary: Gets the channel to use for sending/receiving messages.

member.summary: Gets the security settings for this service provider.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.ServiceProvider.OAuthChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets the channel to use for sending/receiving messages.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat
member.summary: The different formats a user authorization verifier code can take in order to be as secure as possible while being compatible with the type of OAuth Consumer requesting access.
member.remarks: Some Consumers may be set-top boxes, video games, mobile devies, etc. with very limited character entry support and no ability to receive a callback URI. OAuth 1.0a requires that these devices operators must manually key in a verifier code, so in these cases it better be possible to do so given the input options on that device.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat.IncludedInCallback
member.summary: The strongest verification code. The best option for web consumers since a callback is usually an option.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat.AlphaNumericNoLookAlikes
member.summary: A combination of upper and lowercase letters and numbers may be used, allowing a computer operator to easily read from the screen and key in the verification code.
member.remarks: Some letters and numbers will be skipped where they are visually similar enough that they can be difficult to distinguish when displayed with most fonts.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat.AlphaUpper
member.summary: Only uppercase letters will be used in the verification code. Verification codes are case-sensitive, so consumers with fixed keyboards with only one character case option may require this option.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat.AlphaLower
member.summary: Only lowercase letters will be used in the verification code. Verification codes are case-sensitive, so consumers with fixed keyboards with only one character case option may require this option.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth.VerificationCodeFormat.Numeric
member.summary: Only the numbers 0-9 will be used in the verification code. Must useful for consumers running on mobile phone devices.
